intro: Spatalla thyrsiflora, commonly known as the thyrsofloral spathaceae, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its tall, branching inflorescence and striking, showy flowers that are often brightly colored. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a smooth, waxy surface. Spatalla thyrsiflora is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique and exotic appearance.
